posts.post_content: I could see this being a good EDH general. I think that there are a lot of mono red dragons that have come-into-play abilities and such, and the fact that it can tutor them is really cool. However, the best dragons are multicolored, so I don't know where that would go... it is an interesting card nevertheless. 3.5 for synergy potental.

posts.post_content: I am a little ashamed to admit it, but it has taken me nearly 16 years to realize that 1) It's Zirilan, not Zirilian, and 2) It's probably a proper noun (Zirilan, who is of the Claw) and not a title (a zirilan, belonging to the order of the Claw).

posts.post_content: EDH. This and [Thornbite staff](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thornbite staff). So long as you have 6 untapped mana to spare you can usually grab two dragons per turn as long as one of them kills something. As long as [Utvara Hellkite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Utvara Hellkite ) is the other, you get two 6/6 fliers out of the deal too.

posts.post_content:
5 cost? I wish this guy was JUST. ONE. LESS. :P  
  
I like him a lot, but I'm not going to build mono-red dragons when I could build Scion Rainbow Dragons or Kaalia Dragons Angels Demons. So for my real dragons decks I'd wish he could be played a little faster :/  
  
I think I'd rather play Dragonspeaker Shaman, because I'm not sure yet how much percent of my deck I'm going to let be Red. If it turns out very Red, Zirilan is probably better, but there is a legitimate issue of color density because of the other cards I want to play.  
  
Obviously, if colors are not something you see being an issue because you aren't interested in doing anything except straightforward Dragons Are Awesome, then go ahead and autoinclude him.
posts.html:
5 cost? I wish this guy was JUST. ONE. LESS. :P

I like him a lot, but I'm not going to build mono-red dragons when I could build Scion Rainbow Dragons or Kaalia Dragons Angels Demons. So for my real dragons decks I'd wish he could be played a little faster :/

I think I'd rather play Dragonspeaker Shaman, because I'm not sure yet how much percent of my deck I'm going to let be Red. If it turns out very Red, Zirilan is probably better, but there is a legitimate issue of color density because of the other cards I want to play.

Obviously, if colors are not something you see being an issue because you aren't interested in doing anything except straightforward Dragons Are Awesome, then go ahead and autoinclude him.
